Row.Text: With Your Shield Or On It
Likes civilizations who are willing to form a long-term alliance. Dislikes anyone denouncing or attacking his friends and allies.
Wants to have his Worship building in many cities, and likes a civilization with it. Dislikes civilizations following other Religions, or civilizations waging war on followers of his Religion.
Likes civilizations who are their declared friend. Hates civilizations who backstab and declare surprise wars.
Likes peaceful civilizations that have a city on his home continent. Hates civilizations starting wars against a city-state or civilization based on his continent.
Gains as many Spies and as much diplomatic access as possible. Does not like civilizations who ignore these espionage activities.

Likes civilizations that have a strong military and [ICON_Faith]Faith and [ICON_Culture] Culture output. Dislikes civilizations that are strong in military but weak in [ICON_Faith]Faith and [ICON_Culture] Culture output.
Likes civilizations that aren't competing for the same city-state allegiance. Dislikes civilizations that are directly competing for city-state allegiance.
Likes civilizations who follow the same Religion, and wants his cities to all follow the same Religion. Hates anyone trying to spread their Religion into his empire.
Likes civilizations that aren't competing for the same city-state allegiance. Dislikes civilizations that are directly competing for city-state allegiance.
Likes civilizations that bring Religion to the Kongo. Dislikes civilizations that have founded a Religion but not brought it to a Kongolese city.
Likes civilizations who are not competing for Great People, and will recruit Great People whenever possible. Dislikes losing a Great Person to another civilization.
Likes civilizations who do not associate with city-states. Does not like Suzerains of city-states, or civilizations who conquered city-states.
Builds a large navy and respects civilizations who follow his lead. Does not like civilizations with a weak navy.
Tries to include as much territory as possible in his empire. Does not like civilizations who control little territory.
Likes civilizations who pose no threat. Dislikes civilizations with strong militaries or ones with nearby cities.
Likes civilizations with powerful militaries, and will try to ally with them to avoid damaging military conflicts. Dislikes civilizations with weak militaries.
Never declares wars for which he can be branded a warmonger, and will try to befriend those who maintain the peace. Hates warmongers.
Likes civilizations from her home continent, and wants to expand to all continents. Doesn’t like civilizations on continents where England has no city.

Likes civilizations who have the same Luxury resources as he does, and will try to collect every Luxury resource available. Dislikes civilizations who have a new Luxury resource he has not yet collected.

Friendly to those civilizations that are ahead of him in [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture. Dislikes backwards civilizations that are lacking in [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Never gives up items in a peace deal, and likes civilizations who match that approach. Dislikes civilizations who have capitulated or who have never gone to war.
Likes civilizations not competing for wonders, and builds wonders whenever possible. Dislikes losing a wonder to another civilization.
Sympathizes with the barbarians. Does not like civilizations that destroy barbarian outposts.
Hates barbarians. Likes civilizations that clear out barbarian outposts. Does not like civilizations that ignores barbarian outposts.
Tries to build up [ICON_Culture] Culture, and likes civilizations that also focus on [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Likes to see civilizations at war, and believes in constant struggle.
Tries to make the citizens in each city as happy as possible. Likes civilizations that also develop in this fashion.
Tries to build up industry, and likes civilizations that also focus on [ICON_Production] Production.
Tries to have the highest possible [ICON_Gold] Gold per turn income. Respects other high income civilizations.
Tries to find all natural wonders. Likes civilizations that keep Woods and Rainforest unchopped, and those that establish National Parks.
Has no hesitation to use nuclear weapons. Respects other civilizations that project strength with nuclear weapons.
Tries to have the highest overall population. Respects other high population civilizations.
Always tries to keep a large standing army. Respects other civilizations with large armies.
Tries to build up [ICON_Science] Science, and likes civilizations that also focus on [ICON_Science] Science.
Tries to build up air power. Admires civilizations with greater air power. Dislikes civilizations with weaker air power.
Emphasizes protectorate wars. Admires civilizations that start protectorate wars. Dislikes civilizations that attack city states.

Clears all features and improves all possible tiles. Likes civilizations with a high percentage of improved tiles. Dislikes civilizations with low percentage of improved tiles or that found National Parks.
Builds National Parks, doesn't clear features, plants forests. Likes civilizations that plant forests or found National Parks. Dislikes civilizations that clear features.
Favors civilizations with the same type of government, dislikes civilizations that have different governments, and really dislikes civilizations with different govenments of the same era as its own.
Tries to build up [ICON_Faith] Faith, and likes civilizations that also focus on [ICON_Faith] Faith.
Tries to explore the map, and likes civilizations that have explored less of the map than itself and dislikes civilizations that have explored more of the map than itself.
Additional +2 [ICON_Science] Science in every Campus district.
+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith in every Holy Site district.
Additional +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith in every Holy Site district.
+4 [ICON_Gold] Gold in every Commercial Hub district.
Additional +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold in every Commercial Hub district.
+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture in every Theater Square district.
Additional +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture in every Theater Square district.
+2 [ICON_Production] Production in the [ICON_Capital] Capital when producing units.
+2 [ICON_Production] Production in every Encampment district when producing units.
Additional +2 [ICON_Production] Production in every Encampment district when producing units.
+2 [ICON_Production] Production in the [ICON_Capital] Capital when producing wonders, buildings, and districts.
+2 [ICON_Production] Production in every Industrial Zone district when producing wonders, buildings, and districts.
Additional +2 [ICON_Production] Production in every Industrial Zone district when producing wonders, buildings and districts.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Luxury resource at the destination.
Your cities get +15% [ICON_Production] Production towards wonders.
Your Bonus resources behave like Luxury resources, providing 1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity per type.
Your Encampment districts provide +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity each.
Your cities earn +15% [ICON_Science] Science whenever you are not at war with any civilization.
Provides you with 1 of each Strategic resource you have revealed but do not own.
Your cities get +20% [ICON_Production] Production towards city projects.
Your [ICON_TradingPost] Trading Posts in foreign cities provide +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes passing through.
Automatically converts to the Religion you founded, and exerts pressure for that Religion as if it were a Holy City.
Your units receive double experience from battles they initiate.
Receive a [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic every time you discover a new natural wonder, and earn +50% [ICON_Faith] Faith from all [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to any city-state provide +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every specialty district in the origin city.
Your Builders can now make Colossal Head improvements.
Your Trader units are immune to being plundered on water tiles.
Your cities have full [ICON_Housing] Housing from water, as if they were all next to a River.
Your districts on or next to Coast tiles provide +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Your light and heavy cavalry units have +5 [ICON_Strength] Strength when fighting on hill tiles.
When you enter a new era, earn 1 random [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka from that era.

Your districts provide +1 [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person point of their type ([ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer, [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist, and [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician for Theater Square districts).
Regional effects from your Industrial Zone and Entertainment Complex districts reach 3 tiles farther.

City Center buildings and Encampment district buildings can be bought with [ICON_Faith] Faith. Cost of purchasing Ancient, Medieval, and Renaissance Walls is reduced, but they can only be bought with [ICON_Faith] Faith.
When you enter a new era, earn 1 random [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration from that era.
Your Apostle units can choose from any possible promotion instead of receiving a random promotion.
Receive the [ICON_RESOURCE_CINNAMON] Cinnamon and [ICON_RESOURCE_CLOVES] Cloves Luxury resources. These cannot be earned any other way in the game, and provide 6 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities each.
Harald Hardrada unique unit: Viking Longship
Theodore Roosevelt unique unit: Rough Rider
Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit.

May declare war on anyone at war with their allies without warmonger penalties. When at war with a common foe, they and their allies share pillage rewards and share combat experience gains if within 5 tiles.

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Egypt. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Egypt provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Egypt.

Land units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast; naval units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in shallow water tiles. Builds Encampment, Holy Site and Theater Square districts in half the time.
Inquisitors can Remove Heresy one extra time. Combat units have a bonus of +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions.
Receives [ICON_Science] Science or [ICON_Culture] Culture from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to civilizations that are more advanced than Russia (+1 per 3 technologies or civics ahead).
Additional Military policy slot. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking city-states.
All found or conquered cities on a continent other than your home continent receive a free melee unit. Gain the Redcoat unique unit when the Miltary Science technology is researched.

The worship building for their Religion can be purchased by any player for just one-tenth of the usual [ICON_Faith] Faith cost. This worship building is enhanced to add 10% to the [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Faith] Faith, and [ICON_Culture] Culture output of Arabian cities.

May not build Holy Site districts, gain Great Prophets, or found Religions. Gains all Beliefs of any Religion that has established itself in a majority of his cities. Receives an Apostle each time he finishes a M'banza or Theater Square district (of that city's majority Religion).

Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent. +1 Appeal to all tiles in a city with a National Park. Gain the Rough Rider unique unit when they research the Rifling technology.

+5 [ICON_Faith] Faith for each civilization (including India) they have met that has founded a Religion and is not currently at war. Opposing civilizations receive double the war weariness for fighting against Gandhi.
Allows coastal raiding for all naval melee units.
When building Ancient and Classical wonders you may spend Builder charges to complete 15% of the original wonder cost. Builders receive an additional charge.
Has 1 level of [ICON_VisLimited] Diplomatic Visibility greater than normal with every civilization that she's met. Receives capacity to build an extra Spy with the Castles technology.
All cities start with an additional City Center building. (Starts with a Monument building in the Ancient era).
All units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units. When they eliminate a unit, they heal up to 50 hit points.
After recruiting or patronizing a [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person, 20% of its [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person point cost is refunded.
+5% [ICON_Culture] Culture per city-state you are the Suzerain of.
